item.title: The Lab: JSON Web Tokens
item.description: A deep dive into JSON Web Tokens: what they are, how they’re structured, and more specifically, common misconfigurations and exploits. A JWT JWTs are a core part of the OpenID Connect standard: a standard which extends the identity layer on top of OAuth 2. Whilst the OAuth 2 specification does not stipulate a format for access tokens, the industry has widely adopted the use of JWTs. JWTs are considered stateless. The authorization server does not need to maintain a list of valid JWTs as JWTs are signed using a cryptographic signature which can be checked each time a JWT is used.
